title: besu failing to start
body:

2022-09-23 10:58:05.014+03:00 | main | INFO  | BesuControllerBuilder | TTD difficulty is not present, creating initial sync phase for PoW
2022-09-23 10:58:05.042+03:00 | main | INFO  | RunnerBuilder | Detecting NAT service.
2022-09-23 10:58:05.489+03:00 | main | INFO  | Runner | Starting external services ... 
2022-09-23 10:58:05.490+03:00 | main | INFO  | MetricsHttpService | Starting metrics http service on 172.17.17.108:9545

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Cannot call requestPortForward() when in stopped state

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot map to internal port zero.
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:145)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.nat.upnp.UpnpNatManager.requestPortForward(UpnpNatManager.java:284)

	at org.hyperledger.besu.ethereum.p2p.network.NetworkRunner.start(NetworkRunner.java:80)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.Runner.startEthereumMainLoop(Runner.java:139)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.cli.BesuCommand.run(BesuCommand.java:1436)
	at picocli.CommandLine.executeUserObject(CommandLine.java:1939)
	at picocli.CommandLine.access$1300(CommandLine.java:145)
	at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.executeUserObjectOfLastSubcommandWithSameParent(CommandLine.java:2358)
	at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2352)
	at picocli.CommandLine$RunLast.handle(CommandLine.java:2314)
	at picocli.CommandLine$AbstractParseResultHandler.handleParseResult(CommandLine.java:2172)
	at picocli.CommandLine.parseWithHandlers(CommandLine.java:2559)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.cli.util.ConfigOptionSearchAndRunHandler.handle(ConfigOptionSearchAndRunHandler.java:54)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.cli.util.ConfigOptionSearchAndRunHandler.handle(ConfigOptionSearchAndRunHandler.java:31)
	at picocli.CommandLine$AbstractParseResultHandler.handleParseResult(CommandLine.java:2172)
	at picocli.CommandLine.parseWithHandlers(CommandLine.java:2559)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.cli.BesuCommand.parse(BesuCommand.java:1591)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.cli.BesuCommand.parse(BesuCommand.java:1393)
	at org.hyperledger.besu.Besu.main(Besu.java:49)
Startup failed

To display full help:
besu [COMMAND] --help
2022-09-23 10:58:06.141+03:00 | BesuCommand-Shutdown-Hook | ERROR | Besu | Failed to stop Besu

Which config options are you using? It seems one of the ports is set to zero

```
 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot map to internal port zero.
```

here are my configurations 
# Valid TOML config file
data-path="/home/user/QBFT-Network/Node1/data" # Path

# Network

nat-method="UPNP" 

discovery-enabled=false

p2p-enabled=true

p2p-host="172.17.17.108"

p2p-interface="172.17.17.108"

p2p-port=1234

max-peers=42

rpc-http-host="172.17.17.108"

rpc-http-enabled=true

rpc-http-api=["ETH","NET","QBFT"]

host-allowlist=["172.17.17.165","172.17.17.108","172.17.17.55","172.17.17.83","172.17.17.88"]

rpc-http-cors-origins=["172.17.17.165","172.17.17.108","172.17.17.55","chrome-extension://nkbihfbeogaeaoehlefnkodbefgpgknn","http://remix.ethereum.org","172.17.17.83","172.17.17.88"]

rpc-http-max-active-connections=10

rpc-http-port=8545

rpc-http-tls-client-auth-enabled=true

rpc-http-tls-cipher-suite=["TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384","TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256"]

rpc-http-tls-enabled=false

rpc-ws-enabled=false

sync-mode="FULL"

metrics-host="172.17.17.108"

metrics-port="9545"

metrics-protocol="PROMETHEUS"

metrics-enabled=true

metrics-category=["BLOCKCHAIN","PEERS","PROCESS"]

# Chain
genesis-file="/home/user/QBFT-Network/genesis.json" # Path to the custom genesis file

# Mining
miner-enabled=true
miner-coinbase="0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000"
min-gas-price=0

Can you try with
`metrics-port="9545"` changed to `metrics-port=9545`?

I'm suspicious that setting the port value to a string makes it equal to 0. If this is the case perhaps Besu could make an attempt to do a string -> int conversion if the value is a number.

thank you very much its currently working smoothly
regards
